main event: Radar tracks of unidentified aircraft observed over Sakhalin, Japan on 21-22 Feb 1951 and 26-27 Feb 1951.
interesting points: The radar tracks showed speeds ranging from 120 to 360 mph.
Some of the tracks showed erratic, high-speed movement, with estimates of 600-700 mph.
The report notes that during the 17 Mar 1949 to 20 Feb 1951 period, only 12 tracks were observed during darkness hours, whereas 10 tracks were observed during darkness on 21-22 Feb 1951.
The tracks were tentatively identified as Soviet aircraft by the Air Defense Controller.
Good flying conditions were reported during the observation periods.
